headline: Tanzania on a budget is achievable with strategic choices
summary: Budget-conscious travelers can experience Tanzania's wildlife by choosing value lodges outside parks, traveling during green season, joining group departures, and focusing on the Northern Circuit's established infrastructure. Expect $250-400/day all-inclusive for mid-range options, with budget options at $150-250/day requiring more logistics management.

assumptions.text: Serengeti park fees are $70/day, Ngorongoro $70 entry plus $300 crater fee - fixed costs.
March-May and November rates are 20-40% lower than peak season.
Joining group safaris reduces per-person costs significantly.

losses: Some areas inaccessible in green season

change_conditions: If traveling July-September, expect 30-50% higher prices for same quality.
If you need private vehicle, add $150-200/day to budget.
If Ngorongoro Crater is essential, factor in the $300 conservation fee.
If combining with Zanzibar, budget beach portion separately.
